DOC.brief_summary: To assess outcomes patient ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) assign fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) angiography-guided selective percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Fractional Flow Reserve Versus Angiography Guiding Selective Percutaneous Coronary Intervention ST-segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator retrospectively collect STEMI patient receive selective PCI Jan 2012 Dec 2015 . Clinical follow-up perform date FFR assessment Dec 2016 death , 5 year . The primary endpoint major adverse cardiac event , composite cardiac death , reinfarction unplanned hospitalization due cardiovascular reason . The primary endpoint cardiac death , reinfarction unplanned hospitalization due cardiovascular reason . All death consider cardiovascular unless unequivocal noncardiac cause could establish . Reinfarction define myocardial infarction PCI procedure . Unplanned hospitalization present patient hospitalize unexpectedly persist increase complaint angina , ventricular arrhythmias heart failure . All patient receive FFR-guided PCI angiography-guided PCI enrollment , investigator assign specific intervention subject study . So study might consider observational .
